passage:
(1) School lunch is an important part of the day for students around the world. In Japan, students eat in their classroom. They have rice, fish, soup, and vegetables. Teachers eat with the students and teach them about healthy food choices.

(2) In France, school lunch is very different. Students go to a cafeteria and sit at tables. They eat a full meal with several courses. First, they have a salad. Then, they eat a main dish like chicken or pasta. After that, they have cheese and fruit for dessert.

(3) In Brazil, school lunch often includes beans and rice. This is a common food in Brazil. Students also eat fruit and vegetables from local farms. The food is simple but healthy. Many schools in Brazil grow some of their own food in school gardens.

(4) In India, school lunch programs help many children. The meals often have rice or bread with lentils. Some schools serve different foods each day of the week. These meals give students energy to learn and play. For some children, school lunch is their most important meal of the day.
